name: ED chest pain (synthetic)
note:
ED NOTE

CC: Chest pain
HPI: 54M with HTN, HLD presents with 2 hours substernal chest pressure radiating to left arm. Associated diaphoresis and nausea. No syncope.
Vitals: BP 168/92 HR 104 RR 18 SpO2 98% RA Temp 36.9
Exam: diaphoretic, lungs clear, normal S1/S2, no edema.
ECG: ST depressions V4-V6.
Labs: Troponin I 0.12 (elevated).
Assessment: likely NSTEMI.
Plan: aspirin, heparin drip, cardiology consult, admit to telemetry, serial troponins, start high-intensity statin.

name: Clinic diabetes follow-up (synthetic)
note:
CLINIC NOTE

Subjective: 62F with T2DM here for follow-up. Reports home glucose 150-220. Taking metformin 1g BID; stopped empagliflozin due to recurrent yeast infections.
Objective: A1c 8.9%. BP 132/78. Weight 92kg.
Assessment: uncontrolled T2DM; medication intolerance.
Plan: discuss GLP-1 RA, lifestyle counseling, foot exam, microalbumin, retinal screening referral.
